etymology.description: 䰜(䰜) (lì, "cauldron") + 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") = cauldron with rice, emitting steam -> congee
etymology.interpretation: 鬻(yù) combines a depiction of a cauldron, 䰜(䰜) (lì), with 米(米) (mǐ, "rice"), to form an image of rice being cooked in a cauldron. The two 弓 depict the steam rising from the cooking process, conveying the idea of congee.
etymology.simplification: 粥(粥) (zhōu, "congee") simplifies 鬻(yù) by retaining the 米(米, "rice") while reducing other elements to streamline the character for phonetic reasons as a reduced form of 鬻 used for 'congee'.

examples.chinese: 妈妈煮好的鬻(鬻)，温暖了我的早晨(溫暖了我的早晨)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā zhǔ hǎo de yù, wēnnuǎnle wǒ de zǎochén.
examples.english: The congee cooked by mom warmed my morning.

examples.chinese: 冬天喝一碗鬻(鬻)，使身体感到舒适(使身體感到舒適)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān hē yī wǎn yù, shǐ shēntǐ gǎndào shūshì.
examples.english: Having a bowl of congee in winter makes the body feel comfortable.

examples.chinese: 清晨时享用鬻(鬻)，开启充满活力的一天(開啟充滿活力的一天)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén shí xiǎngyòng yì yù, kāiqǐ chōngmǎn huólì de yītiān.
examples.english: Enjoying congee in the early morning kick-starts a lively day.
